required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Two Investigational Drugs in the Prevention of Airway Constriction Brought on by Exercise in Participants With Asthma (0476-911)
clinical_study.official_title: A Multicenter, Double-Blind, Randomized, Crossover Design Study to Evaluate the Effect of Montelukast Vs. Salmeterol on the Inhibition of Exercise-Induced Bronchoconstriction in Asthmatic Patients Aged 6-14 Years

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this study is to determine the effect of four weeks of treatment with two investigational drugs (oral versus inhaled administration) plus an inhaled medication in the treatment of airway constriction brought on by exercise in participants with asthma.

primary_outcome.measure: Maximum Post-exercise Percent (%) Fall in FEV1
primary_outcome.description: The effect of four weeks of treatment with oral montelukast plus inhaled fluticasone, and inhaled salmeterol plus inhaled fluticasone on EIB as measured by the maximum post-exercise percent fall (relative to pre-exercise baseline) in FEV1.

secondary_outcome.measure: Area Under the Curve for %-Change From Pre-exercise Baseline FEV1 in Liters (L), From 0 to 20 Minutes (AUC(0-20))
secondary_outcome.description: The effect of a four-week treatment course of oral montelukast plus inhaled fluticasone, compared to inhaled salmeterol plus inhaled fluticasone, on the extent and severity of EIB as measured by the area under the curve from 0 to 20 minutes (AUC0-20) for FEV1 percent change from pre-exercise baseline.

secondary_outcome.measure: Maximum FEV1 % Predicted Following First Beta-agonist Use
secondary_outcome.description: The effect of a four-week treatment course of oral montelukast plus inhaled fluticasone, compared to inhaled salmeterol plus inhaled fluticasone, on short-acting β-agonist bronchodilation as measured by the maximum FEV1 percent predicted following first β-agonist use.

secondary_outcome.measure: Time to Recovery to Within 5% of Baseline FEV1
secondary_outcome.description: The effect of a four-week treatment course of oral montelukast plus inhaled fluticasone, compared to inhaled salmeterol plus inhaled fluticasone, on the extent and severity of EIB as measured by the time to recovery (to within 5 percent of the pre-exercise baseline FEV1) following a standardized exercise challenge.

secondary_outcome.measure: Average (Avg) %-Change in FEV1 After First Beta (β)-Agonist Use and Prior to Second β-agonist Use
secondary_outcome.description: The effect of a four-week treatment course of oral montelukast plus inhaled fluticasone, compared to inhaled salmeterol plus inhaled fluticasone, on the extent and severity of EIB as measured by the average percent change in FEV1 after first β-agonist intake and prior to second β-agonist use.

arm_group.description: Period I - Montelukast 5 milligrams (mg) oral tablet once daily and Salmeterol matching placebo dry powder inhaler (DPI) twice daily for 4 weeks followed by a 2-week washout period (salmeterol matching placebo + montelukast matching placebo). Period II - Montelukast matching placebo oral tablet once daily and Salmeterol DPI 50 micrograms (mcg) twice daily for 4 weeks. Inhaled Fluticasone 100 mcg twice daily throughout the study.

Period I - Montelukast matching placebo oral tablet once daily and Salmeterol DPI 50 mcg twice daily for 4 weeks followed by a 2-week washout period (salmeterol matching placebo + montelukast matching placebo). Period II - Montelukast 5 mg oral tablet once daily and Salmeterol matching placebo DPI twice daily for 4 weeks. Inhaled Fluticasone 100 mcg twice daily throughout the study.

intervention.description: Montelukast 5 mg chewable tablet once daily
Salmeterol 50 mcg dry powder per actuation inhaled twice daily
Fluticasone (50 mcg per actuation) 100 mcg inhaled twice daily
Matching placebo to montelukast oral tablet administered once daily.
Matching placebo to salmeterol dry powder for inhalation administered twice daily

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- 6-14 year old children with a history of asthma for at least 12 months
- must demonstrate airway constriction brought on by exercise
Exclusion Criteria:
- is taking any medications that are not allowed in the study

participant_flow.recruitment_details: Multicenter Study (30 Ex-US sites) Study Initiation Date: December 22, 2005 Study Completion Date: November 14, 2008
participant_flow.pre_assignment_details: For randomization, patients fulfilled the following criteria: Forced Expiratory Volume in one second (FEV1) ≥70% predicted while withholding beta (β)-agonist for at least 6 hours Exercise-induced bronchoconstriction (EIB) showing FEV1 ≥15% reduction from baseline while on inhaled corticosteroids demonstrated twice during the run-in period.

group.title: Montelukast / Salmeterol
group.description: Period I- Montelukast 5 milligrams (mg) oral tablet once daily and Salmeterol matching placebo dry powder inhaler (DPI) twice daily for 4 weeks followed by a 2-week washout period (salmeterol matching placebo + montelukast matching placebo). Period II- Montelukast matching placebo oral tablet once daily and Salmeterol DPI 50 micrograms (mcg) twice daily for 4 weeks. Inhaled Fluticasone 100 mcg twice daily throughout the study.

group.title: Salmeterol / Montelukast
group.description: Period I- Montelukast matching placebo oral tablet once daily and Salmeterol DPI 50 mcg twice daily for 4 weeks followed by a 2-week washout period (salmeterol matching placebo + montelukast matching placebo). Period II- Montelukast 5 mg oral tablet once daily and Salmeterol matching placebo DPI twice daily for 4 weeks. Inhaled Fluticasone 100 mcg twice daily throughout the study.

drop_withdraw_reason.title: Patient did not meet inclusion criteria
Patient did not meet inclusion criteria
Patient did not perform Visit 6 exercise

group.title: Montelukast / Salmeterol
group.description: Period I- Montelukast 5 milligrams (mg) oral tablet once daily and Salmeterol matching placebo dry powder inhaler (DPI) twice daily for 4 weeks followed by a 2-week washout period (salmeterol matching placebo + montelukast matching placebo). Period II- Montelukast matching placebo oral tablet once daily and Salmeterol DPI 50 micrograms (mcg) twice daily for 4 weeks. Inhaled Fluticasone 100 mcg twice daily throughout the study.

group.title: Salmeterol / Montelukast
group.description: Period I- Montelukast matching placebo oral tablet once daily and Salmeterol DPI 50 mcg twice daily for 4 weeks followed by a 2-week washout period (salmeterol matching placebo + montelukast matching placebo). Period II- Montelukast 5 mg oral tablet once daily and Salmeterol matching placebo DPI twice daily for 4 weeks. Inhaled Fluticasone 100 mcg twice daily throughout the study.

measure.title: Area Under the Curve from 0 to 20 minutes (AUC0-20)
measure.description: Area Under the Curve for percent-change from pre-exercise baseline FEV1 in liters, from 0 to 20 minutes (AUC0-20)

measure.title: Avg %-change from pre-exercise baseline FEV1 after 1st β-agonist use & prior to 2nd β-agonist use
Maximum percent fall in FEV1 after exercise
Time to recovery
measure.description: Montelukast / Salmeterol, n=71; Salmeterol / Montelukast, n=70

outcome.title: Maximum Post-exercise Percent (%) Fall in FEV1
outcome.description: The effect of four weeks of treatment with oral montelukast plus inhaled fluticasone, and inhaled salmeterol plus inhaled fluticasone on EIB as measured by the maximum post-exercise percent fall (relative to pre-exercise baseline) in FEV1.
outcome.population: The primary efficacy analysis was based on the full analysis set (FAS) population which included all randomized participants who took at least one dose of post randomization study drug and had a measurement for analysis available in both treatment periods of the cross-over design.

group.title: Montelukast
group.description: Montelukast 5 mg oral tablet once daily, inhaled Fluticasone 100 mcg twice daily.

group.title: Salmeterol
group.description: Salmeterol DPI 50 mcg twice daily, inhaled Fluticasone 100 mcg twice daily.

measure.title: Maximum Post-exercise Percent (%) Fall in FEV1
measure.description: The effect of four weeks of treatment with oral montelukast plus inhaled fluticasone, and inhaled salmeterol plus inhaled fluticasone on EIB as measured by the maximum post-exercise percent fall (relative to pre-exercise baseline) in FEV1.
measure.population: The primary efficacy analysis was based on the full analysis set (FAS) population which included all randomized participants who took at least one dose of post randomization study drug and had a measurement for analysis available in both treatment periods of the cross-over design.

analysis.method_desc: Model terms: participant, treatment and period. The treatment test is adjusted for period

outcome.population: The secondary efficacy analysis was based on the FAS population which included all randomized participants who took at least one dose of post randomization study drug and had a measurement for analysis available in both treatment periods of the cross-over design.

reported_events.desc: 154 participants (pts) enrolled, but only 150 took at least 1 dose of each treatment (tx). 78 pts were in Montelukast (M)/Salmeterol (S) sequence (seq) and 76 in S/M seq. 4 pts in M/S seq only took 1st tx; so 78 took M & 74 took S. 4 different pts in S/M seq only took 1st tx; so 76 took S & 72 took M. Total of 150 pts took M and 150 took S.

group.title: Montelukast
group.description: Period I- Montelukast 5 milligrams (mg) oral tablet once daily and Salmeterol matching placebo dry powder inhaler (DPI) twice daily for 4 weeks. Period II- Montelukast 5 mg oral tablet once daily and Salmeterol matching placebo DPI twice daily for 4 weeks. Inhaled Fluticasone 100 mcg twice daily throughout the study.

group.title: Salmeterol
group.description: Period I- Montelukast matching placebo oral tablet once daily and Salmeterol DPI 50 mcg twice daily for 4 weeks. Period II- Montelukast matching placebo oral tablet once daily and Salmeterol DPI 50 micrograms (mcg) twice daily for 4 weeks. Inhaled Fluticasone 100 mcg twice daily throughout the study.

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: Merck supports the publication of results from all centers of a multi-center trial but requests that reports based on single-site data not precede the primary publication of the entire clinical trial. The Sponsor must have the opportunity to review all proposed abstracts, manuscripts, or presentations regarding this study 60 days prior to submission for publication/presentation. Any information identified by the Sponsor as confidential must be deleted prior to submission.

point_of_contact.name_or_title: Senior Vice President, Global Clinical Development
